AppIdentifier.description:
Identifies an application, or instance of an application, and is used to target FDC3 API calls, such as `fdc3.open` or `fdc3.raiseIntent` at specific applications or application instances.

Will always include at least an `appId` field, which uniquely identifies a specific app.

If the `instanceId` field is set then the `AppMetadata` object represents a specific instance of the application that may be addressed using that Id.
AppIdentifier.title: AppIdentifier

appId.description: The unique application identifier located within a specific application directory instance. An example of an appId might be 'app@sub.root'.
appId.title: appId

instanceId.description: An optional instance identifier, indicating that this object represents a specific instance of the application described.
instanceId.title: instanceId

desktopAgent.description: The Desktop Agent that the app is available on. Used in Desktop Agent Bridging to identify the Desktop Agent to target.
desktopAgent.title: desktopAgent

Icon.description: Describes an Icon image that may be used to represent the application.
Icon.title: Icon

type.description: Icon media type. If not present the Desktop Agent may use the src file extension.
type.title: type

Image.description: Describes an image file, typically a screenshot, that often represents the application in a common usage scenario.
Image.title: Image

type.description: Image media type. If not present the Desktop Agent may use the src file extension.
type.title: type

AppMetadata.description:
Extends an `AppIdentifier`, describing an application or instance of an application, with additional descriptive metadata that is usually provided by an FDC3 App Directory that the Desktop Agent connects to.

The additional information from an app directory can aid in rendering UI elements, such as a launcher menu or resolver UI. This includes a title, description, tooltip and icon and screenshot URLs.

Note that as `AppMetadata` instances are also `AppIdentifiers` they may be passed to the `app` argument of `fdc3.open`, `fdc3.raiseIntent` etc.
AppMetadata.title: AppMetadata

name.description:
The 'friendly' app name. 
This field was used with the `open` and `raiseIntent` calls in FDC3 <2.0, which now require an `AppIdentifier` wth `appId` set. 
Note that for display purposes the `title` field should be used, if set, in preference to this field.
name.title: name

instanceMetadata.description: An optional set of, implementation specific, metadata fields that can be used to disambiguate instances, such as a window title or screen position. Must only be set if `instanceId` is set.
instanceMetadata.title: instanceMetadata

title.description: A more user-friendly application title that can be used to render UI elements.
title.title: title

tooltip.description: A tooltip for the application that can be used to render UI elements.
tooltip.title: tooltip

description.description: A longer, multi-paragraph description for the application that could include markup.
description.title: description

icons.description: A list of icon URLs for the application that can be used to render UI elements.
icons.title: icons

screenshots.description: Images representing the app in common usage scenarios that can be used to render UI elements.
screenshots.title: screenshots

resultType.description: The type of output returned for any intent specified during resolution. May express a particular context type (e.g. "fdc3.instrument"), channel (e.g. "channel") or a channel that will receive a specified type (e.g. "channel<fdc3.instrument>").
resultType.title: resultType

appId.description: The unique application identifier located within a specific application directory instance. An example of an appId might be 'app@sub.root'.
appId.title: appId

instanceId.description: An optional instance identifier, indicating that this object represents a specific instance of the application described.
instanceId.title: instanceId

desktopAgent.description: The Desktop Agent that the app is available on. Used in Desktop Agent Bridging to identify the Desktop Agent to target.
desktopAgent.title: desktopAgent

name.description: The unique name of the intent that can be invoked by the raiseIntent call.
name.title: name

AppIntent.description: An interface that relates an intent to apps.
AppIntent.title: AppIntent

intent.description: Details of the intent whose relationship to resolving applications is being described.
intent.title: intent

apps.description: Details of applications that can resolve the intent.
apps.title: apps

DisplayMetadata.description:
A system channel will be global enough to have a presence across many apps. This gives us some hints
to render them in a standard way. It is assumed it may have other properties too, but if it has these,
this is their meaning.
DisplayMetadata.title: DisplayMetadata

name.description: A user-readable name for this channel, e.g: `"Red"`.
name.title: name

color.description: The color that should be associated within this channel when displaying this channel in a UI, e.g: `0xFF0000`.
color.title: color

glyph.description: A URL of an image that can be used to display this channel.
glyph.title: glyph

Channel.description:
Represents a context channel that applications can use to send and receive
context data.

Please note that There are differences in behavior when you interact with a
User channel via the `DesktopAgent` interface and the `Channel` interface.
Specifically, when 'joining' a User channel or adding a context listener
when already joined to a channel via the `DesktopAgent` interface, existing
context (matching the type of the context listener) on the channel is
received by the context listener immediately. Whereas, when a context
listener is added via the Channel interface, context is not received
automatically, but may be retrieved manually via the `getCurrentContext()`
function.
Channel.title: Channel

id.description: Constant that uniquely identifies this channel.
id.title: id

type.description:
Uniquely defines each channel type.
Can be "user", "app" or "private".
type.title: type

displayMetadata.description:
Channels may be visualized and selectable by users. DisplayMetadata may be used to provide hints on how to see them.
For App channels, displayMetadata would typically not be present.
displayMetadata.title: displayMetadata

ContextMetadata.description:
Metadata relating to a context or intent and context received through the
`addContextListener` and `addIntentListener` functions.
ContextMetadata.title: ContextMetadata

source.description: Identifier for the app instance that sent the context and/or intent.
source.title: source

DesktopAgentIdentifier.description:
Identifies a particular Desktop Agent in Desktop Agent Bridging scenarios
where a request needs to be directed to a Desktop Agent rather than a specific app, or a
response message is returned by the Desktop Agent (or more specifically its resolver)
rather than a specific app. Used as a substitute for `AppIdentifier` in cases where no
app details are available or are appropriate.
DesktopAgentIdentifier.title: DesktopAgentIdentifier

desktopAgent.description:
Used in Desktop Agent Bridging to attribute or target a message to a
particular Desktop Agent.
desktopAgent.title: desktopAgent

OpenError.description: Constants representing the errors that can be encountered when calling the `open` method on the DesktopAgent object (`fdc3`).
OpenError.title: OpenError

ResolveError.description: Constants representing the errors that can be encountered when calling the `findIntent`, `findIntentsByContext`, `raiseIntent` or `raiseIntentForContext` methods on the DesktopAgent (`fdc3`).
ResolveError.title: ResolveError

BaseImplementationMetadata.description: Metadata relating to the FDC3 Desktop Agent implementation and its provider.
BaseImplementationMetadata.title: BaseImplementationMetadata

fdc3Version.description:
The version number of the FDC3 specification that the implementation provides.
The string must be a numeric semver version, e.g. 1.2 or 1.2.1.
fdc3Version.title: fdc3Version

provider.description: The name of the provider of the Desktop Agent implementation (e.g. Finsemble, Glue42, OpenFin etc.).
provider.title: provider

providerVersion.description: The version of the provider of the Desktop Agent implementation (e.g. 5.3.0).
providerVersion.title: providerVersion

optionalFeatures.description:
Metadata indicating whether the Desktop Agent implements optional features of
the Desktop Agent API.

OriginatingAppMetadata.description:
Used to indicate whether the exposure of 'originating app metadata' for
context and intent messages is supported by the Desktop Agent.
OriginatingAppMetadata.title: OriginatingAppMetadata

UserChannelMembershipAPIs.description:
Used to indicate whether the optional `fdc3.joinUserChannel`,
`fdc3.getCurrentChannel` and `fdc3.leaveCurrentChannel` are implemented by
the Desktop Agent.
UserChannelMembershipAPIs.title: UserChannelMembershipAPIs

DesktopAgentBridging.description:
Used to indicate whether the experimental Desktop Agent Bridging
feature is implemented by the Desktop Agent.
DesktopAgentBridging.title: DesktopAgentBridging

optionalFeatures.title: optionalFeatures

ImplementationMetadata.description: Includes Metadata for the current application.
ImplementationMetadata.title: ImplementationMetadata

appMetadata.description: The calling application instance's own metadata, according to the Desktop Agent (MUST include at least the `appId` and `instanceId`).
appMetadata.title: appMetadata

IntentResolution.title: IntentResolution

source.description:
Identifier for the app instance that was selected (or started) to resolve the intent.
`source.instanceId` MUST be set, indicating the specific app instance that
received the intent.
source.title: source

intent.description:
The intent that was raised. May be used to determine which intent the user
chose in response to `fdc3.raiseIntentForContext()`.
intent.title: intent

FDC3EventType.title: FDC3 Event Type
FDC3EventType.description: The type of a (non-context and non-intent) event that may be received via the FDC3 API's addEventListener function.

FDC3Event.title: FDC3 Event
FDC3Event.description: An event object received via the FDC3 API's addEventListener function. Will always include both type and details, which describe type of the event and any additional details respectively.

details.title: Event details
details.description: Additional details of the event, such as the `currentChannelId` for a CHANNEL_CHANGED event.

PrivateChannelEventType.title: PrivateChannel Event Type
PrivateChannelEventType.description: Type defining valid type strings for Private Channel events.

PrivateChannelEvent.description: Type defining the format of event objects that may be received via a PrivateChannel's addEventListener function.

details.title: Event details
details.description: Additional details of the event, such as the `currentChannelId` for a CHANNEL_CHANGED event.
